vulnerability.message:
Package: coreutils
Installed Version: 9.4-3ubuntu6
Vulnerability CVE-2016-2781
Severity: LOW
Fixed Version: 
Link: [CVE-2016-2781](https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/cve-2016-2781)
vulnerability.short_description: coreutils: Non-privileged session can escape to the parent session in chroot
vulnerability.full_description: chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

analysis.raw_analysis: The vulnerability is present in the coreutils package. This package is a core part of the Linux operating system, and as such, it is present in every distribution. This package provides a number of utilities, including the ability to compress and decompress files, edit text files, and manipulate strings.

structured_analysis.remediation: Review and apply security best practices
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement security monitoring and regular updates

vulnerability.message:
Package: curl
Installed Version: 8.5.0-2ubuntu10.6
Vulnerability CVE-2025-0167
Severity: LOW
Fixed Version: 
Link: [CVE-2025-0167](https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/cve-2025-0167)
vulnerability.short_description: When asked to use a `.netrc` file for credentials **and** to follow HT ...
vulnerability.full_description:
When asked to use a `.netrc` file for credentials **and** to follow HTTP
redirects, curl could leak the password used for the first host to the
followed-to host under certain circumstances.

This flaw only manifests itself if the netrc file has a `default` entry that
omits both login and password. A rare circumstance.

analysis.raw_analysis: CVE-2025-0167 is a vulnerability in the curl package. This vulnerability is a remote code execution vulnerability triggered by misconfiguration of the curl package when using netrc files.

structured_analysis.remediation: Review and apply security best practices
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement security monitoring and regular updates

vulnerability.message: Ensure top-level permissions are not set to write-all
vulnerability.rule_name: Ensure top-level permissions are not set to write-all
vulnerability.short_description: Ensure top-level permissions are not set to write-all
vulnerability.full_description: Ensure top-level permissions are not set to write-all

analysis.raw_analysis: GitHub Actions workflow has overly permissive write-all permissions which could allow malicious actions to compromise the repository or CI/CD pipeline.

structured_analysis.impact: High - Overly permissive CI/CD permissions could lead to supply chain attacks
structured_analysis.remediation: Review and restrict GitHub Actions permissions to minimum required scope
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement principle of least privilege for all CI/CD workflows

vulnerability.message: The application exports an activity. Any application on the device can launch the exported activity which may compromise the integrity of your application or its data.  Ensure that any exported activities do not have privileged access to your application's control plane.
vulnerability.full_description: The application exports an activity. Any application on the device can launch the exported activity which may compromise the integrity of your application or its data.  Ensure that any exported activities do not have privileged access to your application's control plane.
cwe: CWE-926: Improper Export of Android Application Components

analysis.raw_analysis: Android application exports an activity that could be launched by any application on the device, potentially compromising application integrity and data security.

structured_analysis.impact: Medium - Exported activities could be exploited by malicious apps to access sensitive functionality
structured_analysis.remediation: Review exported activities and restrict access or implement proper access controls
structured_analysis.prevention: Apply principle of least privilege to Android component exports

vulnerability.message:
WebAuthn credential validation should not be bypassed or weakened.
This can lead to authentication bypass vulnerabilities.
vulnerability.full_description:
WebAuthn credential validation should not be bypassed or weakened.
This can lead to authentication bypass vulnerabilities.

analysis.raw_analysis: WebAuthn credential validation bypass detected in Android client code. This pattern could lead to authentication bypass vulnerabilities if credential validation is improperly weakened or bypassed.

structured_analysis.impact: High - Authentication bypass could compromise entire security model
structured_analysis.remediation: Review WebAuthn credential validation logic and ensure proper validation is always performed
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement robust WebAuthn credential validation with proper error handling

vulnerability.summary: jackson-core can throw a StackoverflowError when processing deeply nested data

analysis.raw_analysis: Jackson-core library vulnerability that can cause StackOverflowError when processing deeply nested JSON data, potentially leading to denial of service attacks.

structured_analysis.impact: Medium - DoS vulnerability could cause application crashes with malformed JSON
structured_analysis.remediation: Update jackson-core library to latest patched version
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement JSON depth limits and input validation for JSON processing

vulnerability.name: Storable and Cacheable Content
vulnerability.description: The response contents are storable by caching components such as proxy servers, and may be retrieved directly from the cache, rather than from the origin server by the caching servers, in response to similar requests from other users. If the response data is sensitive, personal or user-specific, this may result in sensitive information being leaked. In some cases, this may even result in a user gaining complete control of the session of another user, depending on the configuration of the caching components in use in their environment. This is primarily an issue where "shared" caching servers such as "proxy" caches are configured on the local network. This configuration is typically found in corporate or educational environments, for instance.
vulnerability.solution:
Validate that the response does not contain sensitive, personal or user-specific information. If it does, consider the use of the following HTTP response headers, to limit, or prevent the content being stored and retrieved from the cache by another user:

Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private

Pragma: no-cache

Expires: 0

This configuration directs both HTTP 1.0 and HTTP 1.1 compliant caching servers to not store the response, and to not retrieve the response (without validation) from the cache, in response to a similar request.

analysis.raw_analysis: ZAP detected that HTTP responses contain cacheable content that could potentially leak sensitive information if cached by shared proxy servers in corporate or educational environments.

structured_analysis.impact: Low - Information leakage through HTTP caching could compromise user sessions
structured_analysis.remediation: Add appropriate HTTP cache control headers to prevent caching of sensitive responses
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement proper HTTP cache control headers for all sensitive endpoints

vulnerability.message:
WebAuthn credential validation should not be bypassed or weakened.
This can lead to authentication bypass vulnerabilities.
vulnerability.full_description:
WebAuthn credential validation should not be bypassed or weakened.
This can lead to authentication bypass vulnerabilities.

analysis.raw_analysis: WebAuthn credential validation bypass detected in Android client code. This pattern could lead to authentication bypass vulnerabilities if credential validation is improperly weakened or bypassed.

structured_analysis.impact: High - Authentication bypass could compromise entire security model
structured_analysis.remediation: Review WebAuthn credential validation logic and ensure proper validation is always performed
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement robust WebAuthn credential validation with proper error handling
